text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

I got some requests from you guys to make
something Retro game related, and,

I was looking back and I saw that we haven’t
made something Pacman themed

in years! So today, I am gonna be giving some
love to the retro games!
And today we are gonna be making Pacman Jigglers!
Let’s get stated!

The things you will need, to make these Jello
Jigglers will be: 6 different flavors

of Jello, we need 6 colors. The colors are
yellow, pink, orange, red, green and blue!

You’re also gonna need 2 measuring cups.
And of course you’ll need a Pacman mold,

I found this one online, and I will put a
link down below if you are interested

in making these. and then to decorate you
will need some cookie icing, this is

just white vanilla cookie icing, I put it
in a plastic bag with a number 1 tip,

and then we’ve got some blue decorative
icing, a little bit of baking spray.

You’ll need a medium sized sauce pan, a
big mixing bowl and a wooden spoon!
Now let’s put it all together!

Jello is super easy to make, it’s 1 of my
favorite recipes, it is super easy mode!

I’m gonna just show you guys the ratios.
So you got a little box and a big box,

and the ratios are so easy, if you’re making
the little box, you’re gonna use

1 cup of boiling water, and 1 cup of cold
water, and then when you’re making

the bigger box size, you’re gonna be using
2 cups of boiling water,
2 cups of cold water.

Today we are gonna be making 5 characters
from Pacman, 4 ghosts and 1 little Pacman.

And I know what you’re gonna say, wait a
minute Ro! There’s 6 colors and only
5 characters, what’s going on there?

That is because yellow is gonna be our Pacman,
pink is gonna be for Pinky the ghost,

orange for Clyde, red for Blinky, and then
for Inky we’re gonna be mixing green and

blue together, because he’s kind of a teal
color. So when you mix these 2 it’s a
little closer to his color.

The first color I’m gonna make is yellow!
We’re gonna make our Pacman jigglers.

So, I’m gonna pour 1 cup of water into our
saucepan, and then I’m gonna take it

over to the stove. Turn your heat up high,
wait for it to boil and as soon as it’s

boiling, remove from heat and take it back
to the baking station.

We’ve got our hot boiling water right off
the stove, and you’re gonna pour it into

a big mixing bowl. Reoooooooow! Ooh, lots
of steam!

Now you’re gonna open your pack of Jello
and pour it all in.

Oooooooh! Now I’m gonna take my wooden spoon
and mix together for about 2 minutes.

After mixing, most of your sugar should be
dissolved, you’re gonna pour in the

1 cup of cold water. And then mix it up 1
more time!

Now that our Jello mixture is ready to go,
you’re gonna take a little bit of baking

spray, and spray inside the molds. And then,
before we pour, I’m gonna put this down,

just to have a flat surface because this is
a little bit floppy, so when you pick it

up you don’t want your liquid falling out.
So I’m gonna put it on top of here.

Take 1 of your measuring cups and take a scoop.
And then you’re gonna carefully
pour and fill your little Pacmans.

Our little Pacmans are ready, and now I’m
gonna make a bunch of the other Jello

flavors! Now that our tray is filled with
all of our different Jello Colors, we are gonna

pop it in the fridge and let it set for 6
hours. This is really important to give

it the time it needs to chill, because if
you try to pop it out before, they’ll

break apart and be liquid-y and gooey. So
I know it’s awhile, so you can find some

fun things to do, so I’m gonna be playing
some Pacman on my phone.

All my little Jello Jigglers have had plenty
of time to set, we’ve got pink ones for

Pinky, Inky, Blinky and Clyde! A bunch of
little Pacmans, and then over here I made

some plain blue ghosts for when the ghosts
are running away.

I popped all the little Pacman molds out of
here, but I just wanted to show

you how to pop out the ghosts. So here I’m
gonna put a little bit of pressure,
here on the back. Oh, there you go, get over there!

Now that we’ve popped out all of our Jello
Jigglers! This part is totally optional,
but I’m gonna decorate!

To decorate, I’m gonna be using some
vanilla cookie icing, I just put it in a bag

with a number 1 tip at the end so I’d have
a little bit more control, and what

I really like about the Jello mold is that has
these little indents for the ghost eyes,
so it makes decorating really easy!

So what you’re gonna do is take your white
frosting and we’re gonna fill in the little

ghosts eyeballs. Once you’ve filled in all
of the white eyeballs, I’m gonna take a

little bit of blue decorating icing, and again
I’ve put a number 1 tip at the end

I have a little bit more control, and
I’m gonna color in the blue eyeballs!
And they’re gonna be pointing towards Pacman!
Because they’re chasing him!

Now I’m gonna decorate the rest of my little
Jello Jigglers, and for the blue ghosts,

when Pacman’s chasing the ghosts, when the
tables have turned!

I’m gonna take my vanilla icing again, and
I’m gonna draw their little zig-zag mouths.
That was… That’s what they look like!

Ta-da! Here are the Pacman Jello Jigglers
that we made today!

These were so much fun! I love Jello and I
also love that they’re bite sized!

Little bite size snacks, they’re just perfect!
And, made me feel a little

nostalgia today, playing Pacman, such a great
retro game!

I hope you guys liked it, I’ll be posting
lots of pictures on Facebook,

Tumblr, Instagram and Twitter, and if you
guys make these, please send me photos.

I love seeing your baking creations, I just
get a big kick out of it!

If you guys have any other ideas for any other Nerdy
Nummies, please let me know,

leave me a comment down below and I will do
my best to make it happen!
Alright, thanks you guys!
Wok-wok-wok-wok-wok-wok-wok-bye-bye-wok-wok-wok-wok-wok-wok-wok-wok-wok-wok!
